3.13.0.0.message: added a verbose error level logging for better debugging of AWS Lambda invocation issues.

3.13.0.1.message: Fixed an issue where Lambda responses with empty or null body caused 500 errors when `is_proxy_integration` is enabled.

3.12.0.0.message: Added support for AWS API Gateway payload v2. A new configuration field `awsgateway_compatible_payload_version` has been added to control the version of the payload.
Fixed an issue where the AWS Gateway compatible payload generated by the plugin did not include the `resource` field in some cases.

3.11.0.0.message: A warning message was added during schema validation on those plugins that contain a function name that does not comply with AWS Lambda's FunctionName pattern.

3.11.0.5.message: Fixed an issue where the AWS Gateway compatible payload generated by the plugin did not include the `resource` field in some cases.

3.11.0.7.message: added a verbose error level logging for better debugging of AWS Lambda invocation issues.

3.10.0.0.message: Fixed an issue that occurred when `is_proxy_integration` was enabled, where Kong's response could behave incorrectly when the response was changed after the execution of the AWS Lambda plugin. The Content-Length header in the lambda function response is now ignored by the AWS Lambda plugin.

3.10.0.6.message: Fixed an issue where the AWS Gateway compatible payload generated by the plugin did not include the `resource` field in some cases.

3.10.0.8.message: added a verbose error level logging for better debugging of AWS Lambda invocation issues.

3.9.0.0.message: Fixed an issue in proxy integration mode that caused internal server error when the `multiValueHeaders` is null.

3.8.0.0.message: A new configuration field `empty_arrays_mode` is now added to control whether Kong should send `[]` empty arrays (returned by Lambda function) as `[]` empty arrays or `{}` empty objects in JSON responses.`
Fixed an issue that the plugin does not work with multiValueHeaders defined in proxy integration and legacy empty_arrays_mode.
Fixed an issue that the `version` field is not set in the request payload when `awsgateway_compatible` is enabled.
Added support for a configurable STS endpoint with the new configuration field `aws_sts_endpoint_url`.

3.7.1.3.message: Added support for a configurable STS endpoint with the new configuration field `aws_sts_endpoint_url`.

3.7.1.2.message: A new configuration field `empty_arrays_mode` is now added to control whether Kong should send `[]` empty arrays (returned by Lambda function) as `[]` empty arrays or `{}` empty objects in JSON responses.`

3.7.0.message: Fixed an issue where the latency attributed to AWS Lambda API requests was counted as part of the latency in Kong.

3.6.1.8.message: Added support for a configurable STS endpoint with the new configuration field `aws_sts_endpoint_url`.

3.6.1.7.message: A new configuration field `empty_arrays_mode` is now added to control whether Kong should send `[]` empty arrays (returned by Lambda function) as `[]` empty arrays or `{}` empty objects in JSON responses.`

3.5.0.message: let plugin-level proxy take effect on EKS IRSA credential provider
Cache the AWS lambda service by those lambda service related fields

3.5.0.7.message: A new configuration field `empty_arrays_mode` is now added to control whether Kong should send `[]` empty arrays (returned by Lambda function) as `[]` empty arrays or `{}` empty objects in JSON responses.`

3.4.3.13.message: Added support for a configurable STS endpoint with the new configuration field `aws_sts_endpoint_url`.

3.4.3.1.message: let plugin-level proxy take effect on EKS IRSA credential provider

the AWS-Lambda plugin has been refactored by using `lua-resty-aws` as an underlying AWS library. The refactor simplifies the AWS-Lambda plugin code base and adding support for multiple IAM authenticating scenarios.
Cache the AWS lambda service by those lambda service related fields

3.3.0.0.message: Added the configuration parameter `disable_https` to support scheme configuration on the lambda service API endpoint.[#9799](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9799)

3.2.1.0.message: Added the configuration parameter `aws_imds_protocol_version`, which lets you select the IMDS protocol version. This option defaults to `v1` and can be set to `v2` to enable IMDSv2.[#9962](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9962)

3.1.0.0.message: Fixed an issue that was causing inability to read environment variables in ECS environment.[#9460](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9460)
Specifying a null value for the `isBase64Encoded` field in lambda output now results in a more obvious error log entry with a `502` code.[#9598](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9598)

3.0.0.0.message: Added support for cross-account invocation through the `aws_assume_role_arn` and`aws_role_session_name` configuration parameters.[#8900](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8900)
The plugin now accepts string type `statusCode` as a valid return when working in proxy integration mode.[#8765](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8765)
The plugin now separates AWS credential cache by the IAM role ARN.[#8907](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8907)
The AWS region is now required. You can set it through the plugin configuration with the `aws_region` field parameter, or with environment variables.
The plugin now allows `host` and `aws_region` fields to be set at the same time, and always applies the SigV4 signature.[#8082](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8082)
Removed the deprecated `proxy_scheme` field from the plugin’s schema.[#8566](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8566)

Changed the path from `request_uri` to `upstream_uri` to fix an issue where the URI could not follow a rule defined by the Request Transformer plugin.[#9058](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9058) [#9129](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9129)

2.8.4.3.message: the AWS-Lambda plugin has been refactored by using lua-resty-aws as an underlying AWS library. The refactor simplifies the AWS-Lambda plugin code base and adding support for multiple IAM authenticating scenarios.

2.8.4.0.message: Added the configuration parameter `aws_imds_protocol_version`, which lets you select the IMDS protocol version. This option defaults to `v1` and can be set to `v2` to enable IMDSv2.[#9962](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9962)

2.8.2.0.message: Fixed an issue where the plugin couldn’t read environment variables in the ECS environment, causing permission errors.

2.8.1.3.message: Added support for cross-account invocation through the `aws_assume_role_arn` and`aws_role_session_name` configuration parameters.[#8900](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8900)

2.8.1.1.message: When working in proxy integration mode, the `statusCode` field now accepts string datatypes.

2.8.0.0.message: Fixed incorrect behavior when configured to use an HTTP proxy and deprecated the `proxy_scheme` config attribute for removal in 3.0.[#8406](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8406)
